image.altText: A woman holding an AFP report into the sovereign citizen movement while looking at the Facebook login screen

props.synopsis: A man who says he was threatened after investigating sovereign citizens says the movement should be labelled a terrorist organisation, but an academic argues this could lead to more violence.

title.children: Would declaring sovereign citizens 'terrorists' reduce violence, or fuel it?

image.altText: An underground rail station.

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan says Melbourne's Metro Tunnel, which has been plagued by delays and cost blowouts, will open before Christmas, with construction of the final two stations now complete.

title.children: Melbourne Metro Tunnel to open in early December

image.altText: A man with only one eye stands next to a woman with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: A young father who lost his eye after contracting a rare infection is suing the hospital that treated him, alleging it ignored his requests to investigate his condition properly.

title.children: 'I feel like I'm dying': Father loses eye after hospital's delayed diagnosis

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: Victoria's prison population has surged by 62 per cent in the last 20 years as the number of accused held on remand triples.

title.children: Rise in Victoria's prisoner numbers outpace population growth

image.altText: A composite image of Megan Fox, Joshua Elmes, Alicia Montebello and Lucus Garzoli

props.synopsis: A coroner determines that the sole survivor of a crash that killed four people at Bochara was behind the wheel during the incident.

title.children: Coroner's warning on crash that killed adult and three teens

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: Optus customers have come forward to report more cases of triple-0 calls failing outside the embattled telcos previously admitted outages.

title.children: Optus customers left angry after more failed triple-0 calls

image.altText: A Facebook post written by Isla Bell's mother with a photo of Isla smiling underneath

props.synopsis: The body of Melbourne woman Isla Bell was so badly damaged that forensic experts were unable to say how she died, a court has been told.

title.children: Forensic pathologist unable to say how 19-year-old Isla Bell died

image.altText: tony stands in house

props.synopsis: More than a dozen customers of MJ Harris Group have told the ABC they have been left significantly out of pocket after the company went into liquidation this week.

title.children: Clients of Melbourne builder lose life savings as company goes bust

image.altText: Erin Patterson with glasses on and head down gets into a van outside court

props.synopsis: Victoria's Director of Public Prosecutions will appeal the sentence handed down to convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson.

title.children: Prosecutors to appeal 'manifestly inadequate' sentence for Erin Patterson

image.altText: Snow covered Mount Bogong

props.synopsis: Locals in Victoria's High Country are warning visitors about the unpredictable conditions in the alpine region, after the bodies of two women were discovered near Falls Creek.

title.children: Dead hikers yet to be identified as locals warn of High Country danger

image.altText: A bus sitting at an angle on the side of a road after driving down an embankment

props.synopsis: A V/Line bus carrying a number of passengers plunges down an embankment in Victoria's south east, prompting a high-angle rescue.

title.children: Passengers rescued after V/Line bus crashes down embankment

image.altText: A bearded man in a sports jersey stands with his arms folded in a country area.

props.synopsis: A council in Victoria's east tells volunteer groups it will no longer pay for their insurance policies, sparking community concerns and raising questions as to whose responsibility it should be.

title.children: Volunteer groups told to cover insurance costs on Crown land

image.altText: Essendon captain Zach Merrett stands in the race looking up as he waits to leads his team out at Carrara.

props.synopsis: Essendon once again firmly states that captain Zach Merrett will not leave the Bombers as all 18 clubs begin the wheeling and dealing on the first day of the AFL's trade period.

title.children: Bombers put their foot down in Zach Merrett saga on opening day of trade period

image.altText: A composite image of two boys, one in a white shirt and one in a collared shirt and dark puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: A court case into the alleged murder of an 18-year-old last year reveals a connection to the fatal attacks on Chol Achiek, 12, and Dau Akueng, 15, on September 6.

title.children: Teen accused over fatal stabbing in Melbourne had history of offending, court hears

image.altText: Bread, jam, biscuits, dip, muesli bars and sausages on a white background.

props.synopsis: The main ingredient in dozens of supermarket products has been reduced, an ABC investigation has found, leading retail and marketing experts to call for more transparency around recipe changes.

title.children: Why you might be paying more for reduced quality at the supermarket

image.altText: Ryan Papenhuyzen lies with his face in the grass during the NRL grand final.

props.synopsis: The new and infinitely more exciting Melbourne Storm are finding out just how hard it is to play their exciting brand of footy when the tension is at its peak.

title.children: The Storm seem to make grand finals for fun, but winning is just out of reach

image.altText: A woman with a dog standing next to a placard saying a home is for sale.

props.synopsis: Councillors say they recognise that small housing is needed to meet housing demand, but state government support will be needed to build key infrastructure.

title.children: Single-person households, couples with fewer kids want smaller homes

image.altText: A man wearing dark blue police uniform

props.synopsis: While Premier Jacinta Allan narrows in on machetes and bail laws, Chief Commissioner Mike Bush is looking to broader horizons as Victoria witnesses record levels of offending.

title.children: Victoria's police chief is forging his own path to fight record crime

image.altText: A bald man in a blue suit, white shirt and blue tie walks along a street with tv cameras surrounding him.

props.synopsis: The drug kingpin has had a mixed result in his appeal against three convictions, with a possible retrial looming.

title.children: Tony Mokbel cleared of some drug trafficking charges

image.altText: A photo of people wearing black shirts with prints, holding protest signs, photos and flowers

props.synopsis: Around 600 people attend a justice march for Kaiden Morgan-Johnston, who died after he was allegedly stabbed while walking to a friend's house in Morwell.

title.children: Community unites to demand justice for beloved Aboriginal dancer

image.altText: A blurry phot of a hut covered in snow.

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed they have located two women dead at Nelse, near Falls Creek in Victoria's alpine area.

title.children: Two women found dead near remote Victorian alpine hut

image.altText: A pothole on a road in the foreground and three cars drive in the background  on roads.

props.synopsis: New data obtained by the ABC under Freedom of Information laws show the majority of claims for compensation by drivers encountering hazards on Victorian roads are being rejected.

title.children: Just 1 per cent of state's road damage compensation claims approved

image.altText: Two smiling Carlton players stand on the field with their arms around each other's shoulders after a game.

props.synopsis: Clubs move to formalise deals as the free agency period gets underway, while a series of big names could be on the move in next week's trade period.

title.children: Saints win big with Blues duo as AFL free agency begins

image.altText: Four women in identical cycling gear raise a red quad tandem bike to their shoulders.

props.synopsis: Four ladies are baffling bike shop mechanics, riding a custom-made quad tandem bike across Australia for charity.

title.children: Heads turn during Australia's first transcontinental quad tandem bike ride

image.altText: A stormwater drain

props.synopsis: The City of Yarra mayor has lashed the government over the mapping, saying residents will bear the costs of inadequate infrastructure investment.

title.children: New Melbourne flood mapping sparks outrage from inner-city council

image.altText: Alex in a suit standing in a field at a press conference with microphones.

props.synopsis: Leading members of Australian Jewish communities are reeling after a fatal attack at a synagogue in the UK on the holy day of Yom Kippur.

title.children: 'Our fears are justified': Australia's Jewish community mourns UK attack

image.altText: A brown bug with vivid red and blue stripes on its abdomen.

props.synopsis: Whether you love beetles or the giant mantis it's time to cast your vote for Australia's top insect.

title.children: Vote for your favourite Australian Insect of the Year

image.altText: A line of cars behind a truck in Wodonga.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old girl has died in a crash involving an allegedly stolen car in Wodonga, as police investigate two deadly collisions in Victoria's north in the space of 12 hours.

title.children: Teenage girl dies in crash involving allegedly stolen car

image.altText: Fairy lights glow from behind plastic sheets on a building that says "Punka Pub" at dusk.

props.synopsis: Businesses hurt by stay-away orders issued during the search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman say they have yet to receive the government support they were promised.

title.children: As the Dezi Freeman manhunt drags on, so do the dark days in Porepunkah

image.altText: An aerial photo of a crane lifting a train carriage off a section of curved track.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne passenger train that derailed earlier in the year was travelling on a set of tracks that had been upgraded just days earlier, a preliminary report into the incident has found.

title.children: Derailed train travelling on recently upgraded tracks, report finds

image.altText: Hawthorn players celebrate by tipping their water bottles onto a teammate in the middle of a huddle

props.synopsis: Hawthorn posts a third consecutive AFLW victory to boost its top-four hopes, outlasting Fremantle in cold and windy conditions in Frankston.

title.children: Hawks prove AFLW top-four credentials with tough win over Freo

image.altText: A double-storey white church building sits behind a green fence.

props.synopsis: Multiple investigations are examining a Victorian church's response to an assault committed by a senior pastor's son, amid allegations that information was withheld from the church community.

title.children: Church under investigation after pastor's son sexually assaulted teen

image.altText: Essendon captain Zach Merrett stands in the race looking up as he waits to leads his team out at Carrara.

props.synopsis: Zach Merrett's speech after winning Essendon's best and fairest seems like a farewell, but it will be up to the Bombers as to whether the captain is allowed to leave the club in the AFL trade period.

title.children: Merrett's future in Bombers' hands despite star's apparent farewell

image.altText: A nurse sitting behind a thin green curtain in a busy emergency department.

props.synopsis: An increase in mental health and drug-related emergencies puts strain on Bendigo hospital's emergency department, prompting calls for a dedicated treatment hub.

title.children: Regional nurses under pressure as mental health emergencies climb

image.altText: Clayton Oliver stands with his hands on his head after a 2025 AFL match.

props.synopsis: Clayton Oliver appears set to leave Melbourne after the Demons reveal they will not stand in his way if he wants to consider a trade to another club.

title.children: Demons happy for Oliver to 'explore his options' in AFL trade period
